page.title: 15CHURCHES IN SELSEY
page.content: Selsey is rich in churches. St. Peter's church was built at Church Norton in 681. In 1844 it was knocked down, except for the chancel. It was built again in 1866 in Selsey, with a new chancel added. Both are now used as places of worship. Selsey is one parish with two parish churches. The parish graveyard is still at Church Norton. The Methodist Church was built in 1867, mainly of stones from the beach. Its pews came from a church in Croydon and the font from the former United Reform Church in Chichester. The Roman Catholic Church of St. Wilfrid was built in 1961 and serves a community of about 250 parishioners. The East Beach Evangelical Church is only 8 years old with members from many different denominations.
